description: This trap is issued if configuration of a single variable
with integer type was changed (via ANY interface).
TrapChangedValueInteger variable may contain current reading
of that variable.
trapPerceivedSeverity - 'indeterminate'
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD OMNI-gx2litePS-MIB::trapLitepsConfigChangeInteger NLSBBN-TRAPS-MIB::trapIdentifier i 9999 NLSBBN-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemModelNumber s EXAMPLE NLSBBN-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemSerialNum s EXAMPLE NLSBBN-TRAPS-MIB::trapPerceivedSeverity i 1 NLSBBN-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemOperState i 1 NLSBBN-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemAlarmStatus i 1 NLSBBN-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemAdminState i 1 NLSBBN-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemAvailStatus i 1 NLSBBN-TRAPS-MIB::trapText s EXAMPLE NLSBBN-TRAPS-MIB::trapChangedObjectId o 1.3.6.1.4.1.8072.2.1.1 NLSBBN-TRAPS-MIB::trapChangedValueInteger i 9999 NLSBBN-TRAPS-MIB::trapNETrapLastTrapTimeStamp t 31536000

description: This object identifies the trap issued by the
network element.
variables.name: NLSBBN-TRAPS-MIB::trapIdentifier

description: The value of this object is the model number of
the network element. Combination of Model # and Serial # is used as the unique
identifier of the NE.
variables.name: NLSBBN-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemModelNumber

description: The value of this object is the serial number of
the network element. Combination of Model # and Serial # is used as the unique
identifier of the NE.
variables.name: NLSBBN-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemSerialNum

description: This parameter defines five severity levels, which provide
an indication of how it is perceived that the capability
of the managed object has been affected. The other level
is not a severity level, but indicates that an alarm has been
cleared, and thus is no longer in alarm state. Note that this
field has no meaning for configuration change traps.
variables.name: NLSBBN-TRAPS-MIB::trapPerceivedSeverity

description: The current Operational State of the Network Element
which generated the trap.
variables.name: NLSBBN-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemOperState

description: The current Alarm Status of the Network Element
Alarm Status is always equal to the highest severity
level of all outstanding alarms in this NE.
variables.name: NLSBBN-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemAlarmStatus

description: The current Adminsitrative state of the network element.
variables.name: NLSBBN-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemAdminState

description: The current Operational state of the network elment
is defined in ISO/IEC 10164-2.
variables.name: NLSBBN-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemAvailStatus

description: This variable contains an optional trap text.
variables.name: NLSBBN-TRAPS-MIB::trapText

description: This variable identifies the object that
has generated the trap.
variables.name: NLSBBN-TRAPS-MIB::trapChangedObjectId

description: This 32 bit integer is used to hold specific information about
the trap.
variables.name: NLSBBN-TRAPS-MIB::trapChangedValueInteger

description: This OBJECT IDENTIFIER is used to hold time since NE was 'CHANGED'
last time. 'CHANGE' is defined as:
1) any write operation was performed on this NE which caused a trap.
2) any alarm was generated by this NE which caused a trap.
3) any alarm was cleared on this NE which caused a trap.
variables.name: NLSBBN-TRAPS-MIB::trapNETrapLastTrapTimeStamp

description: This trap is issued if configuration of a single variable
with DispalayString type was changed (via ANY interface).
TrapChangedValueDisplayString variable may contain current reading
of that variable.
trapPerceivedSeverity - 'indeterminate'

event.Summary: PS display string variable configuration changed

description: This trap is issued when Fan 1 is in an alarm condition.

description: This variable contains an optional trap text.
variables.name: NLSBBN-TRAPS-MIB::trapText

description: This variable identifies the object that
has generated the trap.
variables.name: NLSBBN-TRAPS-MIB::trapChangedObjectId

description: This 32 bit integer is used to hold specific information about
the trap.
variables.name: NLSBBN-TRAPS-MIB::trapChangedValueInteger

description: This OBJECT IDENTIFIER is used to hold time since NE was 'CHANGED'
last time. 'CHANGE' is defined as:
1) any write operation was performed on this NE which caused a trap.
2) any alarm was generated by this NE which caused a trap.
3) any alarm was cleared on this NE which caused a trap.
variables.name: NLSBBN-TRAPS-MIB::trapNETrapLastTrapTimeStamp

description: This trap is issued when the 3.7 Volts is in an alarm condition.

Summary.eval: ($v6==1) ? 'PS 3 volt alarm cleared' : 'PS 3 volt alarm status: $v6'

description: This object identifies the trap issued by the
network element.
variables.name: NLSBBN-TRAPS-MIB::trapIdentifier

description: The value of this object is the model number of
the network element. Combination of Model # and Serial # is used as the unique
identifier of the NE.
variables.name: NLSBBN-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemModelNumber

description: The value of this object is the serial number of
the network element. Combination of Model # and Serial # is used as the unique
identifier of the NE.
variables.name: NLSBBN-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemSerialNum

description: This parameter defines five severity levels, which provide
an indication of how it is perceived that the capability
of the managed object has been affected. The other level
is not a severity level, but indicates that an alarm has been
cleared, and thus is no longer in alarm state. Note that this
field has no meaning for configuration change traps.
variables.name: NLSBBN-TRAPS-MIB::trapPerceivedSeverity

description: The current Operational State of the Network Element
which generated the trap.
variables.name: NLSBBN-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemOperState

description: The current Alarm Status of the Network Element
Alarm Status is always equal to the highest severity
level of all outstanding alarms in this NE.
variables.name: NLSBBN-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemAlarmStatus

description: The current Adminsitrative state of the network element.
variables.name: NLSBBN-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemAdminState

description: The current Operational state of the network elment
is defined in ISO/IEC 10164-2.
variables.name: NLSBBN-TRAPS-MIB::trapNetworkElemAvailStatus

description: This variable contains an optional trap text.
variables.name: NLSBBN-TRAPS-MIB::trapText

description: This variable identifies the object that
has generated the trap.
variables.name: NLSBBN-TRAPS-MIB::trapChangedObjectId

description: This 32 bit integer is used to hold specific information about
the trap.
variables.name: NLSBBN-TRAPS-MIB::trapChangedValueInteger

description: This OBJECT IDENTIFIER is used to hold time since NE was 'CHANGED'
last time. 'CHANGE' is defined as:
1) any write operation was performed on this NE which caused a trap.
2) any alarm was generated by this NE which caused a trap.
3) any alarm was cleared on this NE which caused a trap.
variables.name: NLSBBN-TRAPS-MIB::trapNETrapLastTrapTimeStamp
